title: ggplot2 extenders ðŸ«–
text:
Welcome to ggplot2 extenders/ggplot2 extension club. This forum exists to facilitate conversations about experiences with extension. We like to talk about motivations, challenges, equivocations â€” in general, extension journeys!
Our main activities are meetings and discussions.
Note that the extension ecosystem is extensive and other initiatives exist to support extenders, check out our incomplete list of unaffliated resources

title: ggplot2 extenders
ggplot-extension-club
text:
A repository as a discussion place for extending the ggplot2 R package.
As a bit of background: some people have been meeting virtually every few months and discussing ggplot2 extension.
Upcoming meeting:

{animint2}, Toby Hocking, August 19, 2024

Past meetings

{ggnewscale}, Elio Campitelli, June 22/23, 2024
{ggedit}, Jonathan Sidi, May 11, 2024
A conversation with Di Cook {GGally}, March 12/13, 2024
{ggdag}, Malcolm Barrett, Feb 10, 2024
{ggflowchart} Nicola Rennie & {arrowheadr} W. Joel Schneider Nov 4, 2023
{ggeasy} Jonathan Carroll, Sept 2, 2023
{ggsurvfit}, Daniel Sjoberg, June 10, 2023
{ggcirclepack}, Gina Reynolds, April 15, 2023
Fundamentals of Data Visualization, Claus Wilke, Jan 28, 2022
{ggtrace}, June Choe, July 16, 2022
{ggh4x}, Teun Van Den Brand, June 11, 2022
{geomtextpath} Allan Cameron May 7, 2022
{ggbump} David Sjoberg, April 9, 2022
First meeting, March 19, 2022

This repository will accommodate some discussion outside those meetings and coordination efforts. Feel free to participate in discussions and be in touch!

title: ggplot2 extenders
text: Check out our discussion forum where you can contribute to existing threads or bring up new topics. Hot topics include practical questions on API for diverging bar charts and annotating a single facet as well as more theoretical terrain about ggproto inheritance.
